description: From punctilio (“fine point in exactness of conduct”) +‎ -ous.

adjectives.description: punctilious (comparative more punctilious, superlative most punctilious)

entries.meaning: Strictly attentive to detail; meticulous or fastidious, particularly to codes or conventions.
examples: With a punctilious slap of the gloves, the duel was now inevitable.

entries.meaning: Precise or scrupulous; finicky or nitpicky.
examples: Synonyms: finicky, nitpicky, precise; see also Thesaurus:meticulous
